repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
Hmm, I'm surprised LuaLS isn't properly type narrowing here.

I think this is the longstanding bug where if the RHS contains the LHS, then LuaLS gets confused what the type is.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -168,6 +170,7 @@ function M._version(version, strict) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/la
   end
 
   if not strict then -- TODO: add more "scrubbing".
+    --- @cast version string

@@ -298,8 +301,9 @@ function M.range(spec) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim
 
   local semver = M.parse(version)
   if semver then
-    local from = semver
-    local to = vim.deepcopy(semver, true)
+    local from = semver --- @type Version?
+    local to = vim.deepcopy(semver, true) --- @type Version?
+    ---@diagnostic disable: need-check-nil

comment_data.body: Again, better to use assert to resolve nil warnings.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -332,6 +336,7 @@ function M.range(spec) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim
         end
       end
     end
+    ---@diagnostic enable: need-check-nil
     return setmetatable({ from = from, to = to }, { __index = VersionRange })

comment_data.body: Isn't this changing the argument order?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -32,7 +32,7 @@ local M = {}
 ---               Plugins reimplementing `vim.ui.select` may wish to
 ---               use this to infer the structure or semantics of
 ---               `items`, or the context in which select() was called.
----@param on_choice function ((item|nil, idx|nil) -> ())
+---@param on_choice fun(idx: integer|nil, item: any|nil)

comment_data.body: Just to double check: The function didn't work with non-list tables before?
Yeah the issue is that `Version` is a technically a table, but LuaLS doesn't realize that and so it thinks that here `version` is of type `Version|string` and so it complains about the `match`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -168,6 +170,7 @@ function M._version(version, strict) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/la
   end
 
   if not strict then -- TODO: add more "scrubbing".
+    --- @cast version string

comment_data.body: The issue isn't with `mods` but with `from` and `to`. I made them nullable because some if-blocks will assign `nil`, but then that causes code like `to.patch` to warn. I could add the `assert`s before all of those accesses, but I think it might be an overkill and sacrifice readability.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -298,8 +301,9 @@ function M.range(spec) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim
 
   local semver = M.parse(version)
   if semver then
-    local from = semver
-    local to = vim.deepcopy(semver, true)
+    local from = semver --- @type Version?
+    local to = vim.deepcopy(semver, true) --- @type Version?
+    ---@diagnostic disable: need-check-nil

comment_data.body: Refer to my previous response regarding the `from/to` story.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -332,6 +336,7 @@ function M.range(spec) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim
         end
       end
     end
+    ---@diagnostic enable: need-check-nil
     return setmetatable({ from = from, to = to }, { __index = VersionRange })

@@ -32,7 +32,7 @@ local M = {}
 ---               Plugins reimplementing `vim.ui.select` may wish to
 ---               use this to infer the structure or semantics of
 ---               `items`, or the context in which select() was called.
----@param on_choice function ((item|nil, idx|nil) -> ())
+---@param on_choice fun(idx: integer|nil, item: any|nil)

comment_data.body: So I had initially added this because LuaLS couldn't infer the type of `i`, but when reading the doc and code I figured out that `ipairs` was better suited here. After changing the type of `items` from `table` to `any[]` then `pairs` doesn't generate a warning anymore, but I still think `ipairs` is intended here?
I'm not sure how swapping for an `assert` is less readable than `@diagnostic` lines.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -298,8 +301,9 @@ function M.range(spec) -- Adapted from https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim
 
   local semver = M.parse(version)
   if semver then
-    local from = semver
-    local to = vim.deepcopy(semver, true)
+    local from = semver --- @type Version?
+    local to = vim.deepcopy(semver, true) --- @type Version?
+    ---@diagnostic disable: need-check-nil

comment_data.body:
Oh wait sorry. Just realised this is `disable` and not `disable-next-line`.

~I still think in principle I'd prefer the asserts. I don't think it will reduce readability.~

Ok, nvm. Just leave this for now. I can try and improve it in a follow up.
